description: The underlying issue is related to the need for proper installation and configuration of Extended Security Updates (ESU) for Windows Server 2012 R2, specifically addressing the transition from standard support to obtaining security updates after the end of the original support lifecycle on October 10, 2023. This scenario indicates a common misconfiguration where administrators may not adequately prepare their systems for ongoing security updates as they shift to Extended Support. The required updates include KB-5032308, which is the November servicing stack update (SSU), and KB-5017220, the ESU licensing preparation package. Failing to install these updates can lead to an inability to receive future security patches, thereby exposing the system to security risks. Administrators are also advised to verify their update services and perform a rescan against Windows Update after applying the necessary packages to ensure compliance and patch status.
